page.title: 06DUNSFORD'S BLACKSMITH
page.content: We believe that the Smallridge family is the longest father to son chain of blacksmiths in the country.The present blacksmith took over ten years ago.In the forge there is a great big granite trough for cooling horse shoes which weighs at least one ton.The building is made of stone and cob and is about 150 years old. The blacksmith starts at 8.00.am and finishes at 5.00pm. His job is shoeing horses and making iron tools.He has nobody to help him and it must be very hard work.He has to trim the hooves to the right size,then he has to heat up the shoe and shape it to fit by hammering it on his anvil.
